mapper.insert: insert into SYS_LOGIN_LOG (SEQ_NO, USER_ID, LOG_TYPE, LOG_TIME, LOG_CONTENT, CLIENT_IP, CREATE_DATE, CREATE_TIME, CREATE_USER, UPDATE_DATE, UPDATE_TIME, UPDATE_USER, TIME_STAMP, REC_STAT) values (#{seqNo,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{userId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{logType,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, sysdate, #{logContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{clientIp,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createDate,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{updateDate,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{updateTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{updateUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{timeStamp,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{recStat,jdbcType=VARCHAR})
mapper.update: update SYS_LOGIN_LOG set USER_ID = #{userId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, LOG_TYPE = #{logType,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, LOG_TIME = #{logTime,jdbcType=DATE}, LOG_CONTENT = #{logContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, CLIENT_IP = #{clientIp,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, CREATE_DATE = #{createDate,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, CREATE_TIME = #{createTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, CREATE_USER = #{createUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, UPDATE_DATE = #{updateDate,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, UPDATE_TIME = #{updateTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, UPDATE_USER = #{updateUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, TIME_STAMP = #{timeStamp,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, REC_STAT = #{recStat,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where SEQ_NO = #{seqNo,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select: select SEQ_NO, USER_ID, LOG_TYPE, LOG_TIME, LOG_CONTENT, CLIENT_IP, CREATE_DATE, CREATE_TIME, CREATE_USER, UPDATE_DATE, UPDATE_TIME, UPDATE_USER, TIME_STAMP, REC_STAT from SYS_LOGIN_LOG where SEQ_NO = #{seqNo,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

select SEQ_NO, USER_ID, LOG_TYPE, LOG_TIME, LOG_CONTENT, CLIENT_IP, CREATE_DATE, CREATE_TIME, CREATE_USER, UPDATE_DATE, UPDATE_TIME, UPDATE_USER, TIME_STAMP, REC_STAT from SYS_LOGIN_LOG order by log_time desc

select seq_no,user_id,log_type,log_time,log_content,client_ip,create_date,create_time, create_user,update_date,update_time,update_user,time_stamp,rec_stat from SYS_LOGIN_LOG where 1=1
and seq_no like CONCAT(CONCAT('%',#{seqNo,jdbcType=VARCHAR}),'%')
and log_type like CONCAT(CONCAT('%',#{logType,jdbcType=VARCHAR}),'%')
and log_content like CONCAT(CONCAT('%',#{logContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR}),'%')
and client_ip like CONCAT(CONCAT('%',#{clientIp,jdbcType=VARCHAR}),'%')
and log_time like CONCAT(CONCAT('%',#{logTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}),'%')
and create_date like CONCAT(CONCAT('%',#{createDate,jdbcType=VARCHAR}),'%')
and create_date >= #{startDate}
and create_date <= #{endDate}
and user_id like CONCAT(CONCAT('%',#{userId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}),'%')
order by log_time desc
